Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Joe Biden and Barack Obama directly participated in a plot to have SEAL Team 6 murdered and arranged a massive cash deal as part of a cover-up. There is no evidence to support this claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence linking the Obama administration to the deaths of SEAL Team Six members in a 2011 helicopter crash in Afghanistan. Two military investigations concluded that the crash was caused by a Taliban fighter.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no credible evidence or factual basis for the allegations made against Joe Biden and Barack Obama.
Problematic assumption: The claim is based on a problematic assumption that Joe Biden and Barack Obama were involved in a conspiracy to cover up a failed deal with Iran and the death of Osama bin Laden. This assumption is not supported by any factual evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the claim is based on a conspiracy theory propagated by QAnon and other fringe groups, which has been widely debunked by fact-checkers and media outlets.
